item.title: OOP-Î±: A Critical View on OOP
item.description: A critical view on object oriented programming According to official history object orientation started in the late 1950th, early 1960 as a set of ideas, preset to define the way programming has to be done. What many don’t care to learn is the fact that the understanding what OOP means changed during the end of the 80th up until the early 2000th. Only now the mainstream begins to find some interest in the beginnings.
